:* credativ, [[Skolelinux]], [[UserLinux]]
:* credativ, [[Skolelinux]], [[UserLinux]]
â
Membership remained open to additional organizations with an interest in Debian-based solutions. The most visible abscent from any involvement was the [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] distribution backed by [[Mark Shuttleworth]] and [[Canonical Ltd.]] who declined to join the Alliance. The Ubuntu founder, Mark Shuttleworth stated in 2006 that he did not believe that the DCC Alliance had any future<ref>Ubuntu "Sounder" mailing list [https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/sounder/2006-January/003630.html Mark Shuttleworth: Debian Common Core Alliance] [sic], 2006-01-03.</ref><ref>Linux-Watch, [http://www.linux-watch.com/news/NS8432548714.html Debian, Ubuntu, and the DCC, oh my!], 2006-01-05.</ref>.
+
Membership remained open to additional organizations with an interest in Debian-based solutions. The most visible abscent from any involvement was the [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] distribution backed by [[Mark Shuttleworth]] and [[Canonical Ltd.]] who declined to join the Alliance. The Ubuntu founder, Mark Shuttleworth stated in 2006 that he did not believe that the DCC Alliance had any future<ref>Ubuntu "Sounder" mailing list [https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/sounder/2006-January/003630.html Mark Shuttleworth: Debian Common Core Alliance] [sic], 2006-01-03.</ref><ref>Linux-Watch, [http://www.linux-watch.com/news/NS8432548714.html Debian, Ubuntu, and the DCC, oh my!], 2006-01-05.</ref>.
One of the founding members, [[MEPIS]], later left the DCCA, citing "creative differences". MEPIS transitioned their SimplyMEPIS Linux distribution from a Debian Unstable/DCCA-provided core to an [[Ubuntu Linux|Ubuntu]]-based one<ref>Desktop Linux, [http://www.desktoplinux.com/news/NS6045116609.html MEPIS founder plots transition to Ubuntu], 2006-03-21.</ref>.
One of the founding members, [[MEPIS]], later left the DCCA, citing "creative differences". MEPIS transitioned their SimplyMEPIS Linux distribution from a Debian Unstable/DCCA-provided core to an [[Ubuntu Linux|Ubuntu]]-based one<ref>Desktop Linux, [http://www.desktoplinux.com/news/NS6045116609.html MEPIS founder plots transition to Ubuntu], 2006-03-21.</ref>.
